net.sf.javaml.tools.data

Class FileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.javaml.tools.data.StreamHandler
      • net.sf.javaml.tools.data.FileHandler

  • public class FileHandler
extends StreamHandler
    A class to load data sets from file and write them back.

    The format of the file should be as follows: One instance on each line, all values of an entry on a single line, values should be separated by a tab character or specified with the method and all entries should have the same number of values.

    Only class values are allowed to be non double. If a data set has no labels, then all columns should be double values.

    Author:
    Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)
    See Also:
    Dataset, Instance

      • loadDataset

        public static Dataset loadDataset(java.io.File f,
                  int classIndex)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method will load the data stored in a file..

        Only the column with the class values is allowed to have different values than doubles.

        Symbols that cannot be parsed to numbers will be converted to missing values.

        Parameters:
        f - the file to be loaded.
        classIndex - the index of the column that contains the class labels. This index starts from zero for the first column and should not be negative.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadDataset

      • loadDataset

        public static Dataset loadDataset(java.io.File f,
                  int classIndex,
                  java.lang.String separator)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Load the data from a file.

        All columns should only contain double values, except the class column which can only contain integer values.

        Values that cannot be parsed to numbers will be entered as missing values in the instances.

        When the classIndex is outside the range of available attributes, all instances will have the same class.

        Parameters:
        f - the file to be loaded.
        classIndex - the index of the class value
        separator - the symbol used to separate two fields, typically ,(comma) ;(semi-colon) or \t (tab).
        Returns:
        a data set containing the data from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportDataset

        public static void exportDataset(Dataset data,
                 java.io.File outFile,
                 boolean compress,
                 java.lang.String sep)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Exports a data set to a file. Each instance is output separately with the class label on position 0. The fields are delimited with a tab character. Note: data sets with mixed sparse and dense instances may not be loadable with the load methods.
        Parameters:
        data - data set
        outFile - file to write data to
        compress - flag to indicate whether GZIP compression should be used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when something went wrong during the export

      • exportDataset

        public static void exportDataset(Dataset data,
                 java.io.File file)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Exports a data set to a file. Each instance is output separately with the class label on position 0. The fields are delimited with a tab character. Note: data sets with mixed sparse and dense instances may not be loadable with the load methods. By default compression of the output is turned off.
        Parameters:
        data - data set
        outFile - file to write data to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when something went wrong during the export
